datafield.subfield: Prothocolus abreuiatura, copies of notarial instruments documenting purchases, sales, debts, and last wills and testaments, etc :
Unrestricted, for either reading room or classroom use, but coach user: tight binding.

Most entries end with his notarial formula Ego tacius siluis quondam [Ser?] Stephani de Muffonibus de Feltro publicus Imperiali auctoritate notarius his omnibus et singullis suprascriptis [inter?] et Rogatus scriptsi, generally accompanied by his notarial tabellum. Includes original opening page (fol. i. verso); crossed-out section under the original title records oath he made in 1432; index of people mentioned in the documents added at the front at a later date; loose note (inserted between fol. 30-31) includes the date 1460; loose leaf of accounts is dated 1493.

MS 3327, Container 99: A near contemporary ownership inscription of Jacobus de Muffoni is on the inside front cover; acquired by the Ransom Center in 1973 (R5374) from Jenkins and Company. Binding (Italy 15th c): Limp parchment. Two dark brown tanned calfskin overbands; three fore edge tackets front cover. Three gatherings sewn unsupported, all-along. Six parchment secondary tackets twisted outside on spine (head/tail ends of each of three gatherings), attaching case and overbands. Overbands laced onto covers with red-colored alum-tawed animal skin thongs. No decoration, no title (writing in ink front cover), no fastenings. Red-colored alum-tawed animal skin endbands laced through outer joints. No endleaves.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
